verses.kjv: Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father in law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God, even to Horeb.
verses.ct: Moses was tending the flock belonging to his father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian. He guided the flock beyond the edge of the wilderness and arrived at Horeb, the mountain of God.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the LORD appeared unto him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
verses.ct: There the angel of the LORD appeared to him as a flame blazing from within a bush. Moses looked, and the bush was on fire but was not being destroyed.

verses.kjv: And Moses said, I will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.
verses.ct: Moses said to himself, "Let me go over and examine this incredible sight — why isn't the bush burning up?"

verses.kjv: And when the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called unto him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.
verses.ct: When the LORD saw that Moses had come closer to look, God called out to him from within the bush, "Moses! Moses!" He replied, "I'm here."

verses.kjv: And he said, Draw not nigh hither: put off thy shoes from off thy feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holy ground.
verses.ct: God said, "Don't come any closer. Take your sandals off your feet, because the ground where you are standing is holy."

verses.kjv: Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face; for he was afraid to look upon God.
verses.ct: Then he said, "I am the God of your father — the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob." Moses covered his face, because he was afraid to look at God.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people which are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their taskmasters; for I know their sorrows;
verses.ct: The LORD said, "I have clearly seen the suffering of my people in Egypt. I have heard them crying out because of their slave drivers. I fully understand their pain."

verses.kjv: And I am come down to deliver them out of the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing with milk and honey; unto the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
verses.ct: "So I have come down to rescue them from the power of the Egyptians and to bring them out of that country into a rich and spacious land — a land overflowing with milk and honey — the territory of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites."

verses.kjv: Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me: and I have also seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.
verses.ct: "The outcry of the Israelites has now reached me, and I have also witnessed how brutally the Egyptians are oppressing them."

verses.kjv: Come now therefore, and I will send thee unto Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.
verses.ct: "So now, go. I am sending you to Pharaoh to bring my people, the Israelites, out of Egypt."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto God, Who am I, that I should go unto Pharaoh, and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?
verses.ct: But Moses said to God, "Who am I to go to Pharaoh? How could I possibly bring the Israelites out of Egypt?"

verses.kjv: And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be a token unto thee, that I have sent thee: When thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
verses.ct: God answered, "I will absolutely be with you. And this will serve as proof that I am the one who sent you: after you have brought the people out of Egypt, all of you will worship God on this very mountain."

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto God, Behold, when I come unto the children of Israel, and shall say unto them, The God of your fathers hath sent me unto you; and they shall say to me, What is his name? what shall I say unto them?
verses.ct: Moses said to God, "Suppose I go to the Israelites and tell them, 'The God of your ancestors has sent me to you,' and they ask me, 'What is his name?' What should I tell them?"

verses.kjv: And God said unto Moses, I AM THAT I AM: and he said, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me unto you.
verses.ct: God replied to Moses, "I AM WHO I AM." Then he said, "Tell the Israelites this: 'I AM has sent me to you.'"

verses.kjv: And God said moreover unto Moses, Thus shalt thou say unto the children of Israel, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me unto you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial unto all generations.
verses.ct: God also told Moses, "Say this to the Israelites: 'The LORD, the God of your ancestors — the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob — has sent me to you.' This is my name forever, and this is how I am to be remembered through every generation."

verses.kjv: Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared unto me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt:
verses.ct: "Go and assemble the elders of Israel and tell them, 'The LORD, the God of your ancestors — the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob — appeared to me and said: I have been paying close attention to you and have seen what is being done to you in Egypt.'"

verses.kjv: And I have said, I will bring you up out of the affliction of Egypt unto the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, unto a land flowing with milk and honey.
verses.ct: "'I have declared that I will bring you up out of your suffering in Egypt into the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites — a land overflowing with milk and honey.'"

verses.kjv: And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, unto the king of Egypt, and ye shall say unto him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go, we beseech thee, three days’ journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
verses.ct: "They will listen to you. Then you and the elders of Israel will go to the king of Egypt and say to him, 'The LORD, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us. Please allow us to travel 3 days into the wilderness so we can offer sacrifices to the LORD our God.'"

verses.kjv: And I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand.
verses.ct: "But I know that the king of Egypt will not let you go unless a mighty force compels him."

verses.kjv: And I will stretch out my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.
verses.ct: "So I will use my power and strike Egypt with all the miraculous acts I will perform there. After that, he will let you go."

verses.kjv: And I will give this people favour in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty:
verses.ct: "I will cause the Egyptians to look favorably on this people, so that when you leave, you will not leave with nothing."

verses.kjv: But every woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that sojourneth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters; and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.
verses.ct: "Every woman will ask her neighbor and any woman staying in her household for articles of silver, articles of gold, and clothing. You will put these on your sons and daughters. In this way, you will strip the Egyptians of their wealth."
